1.content:
The shrill shriek of the alarm clock pierced the quiet of the bedroom, swiftly silenced by a rough slap from the bed's sole occupant. Lifting herself out of bed, Kim Nishikawa stretched heavily, ready to wake up and face the day. The shapely woman began going about her usual morning routine, brushing her teeth and hopping in the shower to clean up and wake up. Breakfast would be a simple affair, then she'd be out the door and hopping in her car to get to work.

But where does Kim work?

Kim knew it was important, but boy did those security checks get tedious. There was the key card, had to make sure you had that when you left the house , or else you wouldn't e allowed past the front gate. Then there was the handscannner at the front desk. Then the retina scan. Then the leaches again.

All on all, Kim figured she should be happy they were taking the precautions. At the Enfield Corporation, they worked on a lot of sensitive, secretive things! As such, privacy became their policy, in a way, with a large amount of strange information and technology passing through the building.

As Kim passed the final door, stepping into the lab, she nodded to her associates. This little group of hers had been working on a particularly interesting project for some time. Specifically, they'd been working on...
11.title: A research lab.

111.content:
"Morning Carver, Richards," Kim greeted her colleagues, receiving slightly distracted nods in return. The lack of reaction didn't bother her much, as today was an exciting day for the three of them. They had been working with lab rats for the past four weeks, putting the little vermin through hundreds of tests until they finally received the go ahead to move on to human testing.

Kim grinned as she hung her blazer in the lab's closet and pulled on a lab coat, walking over to her two associates, "So, who's the poor fool we're testing today?"

"Huh?" Richards looked at her in confusion before looking back at his notes, "Uh...you are."

"What?"

"You volunteered last Tuesday to be our first human subject," Carver reminded her with a small smirk, "If I recall correctly, you're getting a little bonus for each successful test."

Kim frowned as she recalled the somewhat impetuous decision she'd made to sign up for testing. In her defense, she'd forgotten to get coffee that day and $700 per test seemed like a good deal at the time.

"Eh, fine with me," she shrugged at her colleagues, "What's first on the list?"

Carver grinned as she looked over the schedule, "Alright, so after you get suited up, we're going to..."
111.title: A psychological study on high stress situations.

Put on the "modified" suit. The test will cover multiple phobias at once.
1112.content:
"Phobias are guaranteed to give good data on high stress with relatively little effort." Carver explained, leafing through her notes. "You'll find an earpiece in the ready room to keep in contact with us. It comes equipped with a micro-sensor to monitor your brainwaves and heart rate."

"That's all well and good..." Kim started. "But I don't really have any of the common phobias. I'm not bothered by spiders, snakes, heights, or confined spaces."

"The higher-ups already took that into account." Richards chimed in. "They've gone over your file and cross-referenced it with a list of common phobias. They found a few that you might not necessarily have, but don't explicitly lack."

Kim shrugged at that. She should have expected as much from the foundation. After all, with the ludicrous budget they were afforded, something as simple as a psychological evaluation being kept on file was to be expected. Realizing she wouldn't be needing her lab coat as a test subject, the scientist shrugged the coat back off, placing it back on the hook she'd grabbed it from.

With a thumbs-up to her colleagues, Kim strode across their research room and past the automatic door labeled "Ready Room" to begin her test. The Ready Room was a simple room barely bigger than a closet. As the door shut behind her, Kim felt a slight lurch as the room began to move, employing its secondary function as an elevator to deliver subjects to their designated testing area. It was impossible to tell just where the room was going until it reached its destination, and Kim knew that such specifics weren't her concern, as her colleagues controlled these variables of the test.

The earpiece Carver had mentioned was sitting conspicuously on a small bench sticking out from a wall of the Ready Room, sitting next to a small plastic bin. Kim picked up the earpiece, gently placing it in her left ear and hearing the light crackle of static as connection was established.

"-in, Kim. Repeat, please report in, Kim." came Carver's voice.

"Kim here. Communication seems to be working just fine." Kim said, noting the surprisingly high sound quality she received from the transmitter.

"Great! Last thing we needed was a technical failure before proper testing even started. Your vitals are showing up just fine, too. Looks like we've got everything we need to get our results. So, Kim, go ahead and open up the plastic bin in the room with you, that's for your uniform."

Wordlessly, Kim lifted the top of the plastic container, peering in to see its contents. As Kim surveyed what the bin offered, Carver spoke again.

"I'm assuming you've opened the bin, so please-"

Kim reluctantly began unbuttoning her shirt and once her lacy black bra was visible she stopped. Why was she going through with this? They did say this was a test of public nudity after all. Kim was suddenly feeling very hot.

“Carver, look at these readings,” She heard Richards say through her earpiece. “Elevated anxiety levels and body temperature and she hasn’t even disrobed yet.”

Kim knew it! They could see her! That cut it, she wasn’t going to go through with this experiment and she quickly buttoned up her blouse.

“Is there a problem, Kim?” Carver asked.

“I-I can’t do this,” she replied. “It’s too much and knowing that you both as well as others are going to see me is more than I can deal with.”

“I see,” Richards said flatly. “Hold on.”

Looking at Carver, Richards hit the button that disconnected Kim’s earpiece so that they could talk privately.

“Well this sucks,” Carver said disappointedly. “I guess we’ll have to find another test subject.”

“Don’t you see what an opportunity this is?” Richards asked. “We can introduce other elements! Surely one of them will be enough of a trigger to get her to continue. Just play along.”

Richards then hit the button to reconnect with Kim.

“Hello? Are you guys still there?” Kim asked.

“Yes, sorry Kim,” Richards replied. “We had to contact the director to ask him how to proceed since you seem unwilling to participate further. He has instructed me that if you don’t disrobe…”

1112122.content:
"What?! B-But I thought these tests were supposed to be voluntary!" Kim protested. She'd spent weeks running stress tests on vermin, she couldn't be kicked off right as things were getting interesting!

"Apologies," Richards responded, making a quick note of her increase in heart rate, "But refusal to comply requires immediate dismissal of the subject from the experiment. It's regulations."

"But I'm part of the research team!"

"Not currently," Carver chimed in, "Right now you're a volunteer test subject and under the recently updated Regulation 9, Sub-Clause E, 'all non-compliant test subjects are to be considered a liability to the experiment and should be removed from any and all lab procedures until either compliance is achieved or a compliant test subject is found as replacement. In the case of replacement, the original subject should be removed entirely to prevent possible skewing of test results'. Since you volunteered, you only count as a test subject, and can be kicked off of the project completely if you don't go along with it. Sorry Kim, it's the rules."

Kim couldn't help groaning at Carver's explanation. She really wished she'd known that rule before volunteering for the tests. She'd gotten too used to Richards reminding her about the important ones. Curse her apathy towards company memos! (Since she couldn't see into her colleagues' lab, she completely missed the bewildered look Richards gave Carver as he mouthed "Regulation nine, sub-clause see?", nor did she see the casual shrug given in response)

"...Fine. Fine, I-I'll just..." She swallowed uneasily, fully unbuttoning her blouse and pulling the garment off. She stood still for a second before dropping the garment into bin, an odd sense of finality to the action.

Kim took a breath to steady herself, somewhat unnerved by her colleague's silence as she stood shirtless in the empty room, her lacy bra clearly exposed to them. She shakily lowered her hands to her slacks and unzipped them, quickly shoving her pants down, kicking off her shoes to make it easier, and slipped out of them, dropping the pants and shoes on top of her shirt.

Wearing only her socks and underwear, Kim nervously raised her hands to unclasp her bra. "A-Are you sure I need to be completely naked for the test?" she asked, torn between a desire to just get it over with and a fear of being seen naked. The fact that this anxiety was exactly the point of the test was currently lost on her.

"Huh? Oh, yes," Richards replied, tearing his eyes away from the fascinatingly increasing readings on the screen, "Please continue disrobing so we can receive precise results. Oh, and thank you for your efforts. This recording will be quite helpful in determining future experiments."

"...Recording?" Kim asked weakly. "This is being recorded?"

"...Ah, goddammit Greg," She heard Carver mutter.

"What? What did I do?" The scientist could barely hear her coworker's confused response, the full implications of his casual admission still ringing in her ears. She was being recorded. They were recording her undressing. It did make sense for them to actually record the session rather than simply monitor her, but that didn't stop her increasing panic. How many people were going to be shown a video of her stripping? Oh god, people were going to see her standing around in her underwear like an idiot, hands frozen in the process of removing her bra.

She couldn't go through with this. She couldn't. But to be kicked off the project at this point, after all her hard work? And they already recorded her stripping down to her bra and panties. Would it really make such a huge difference if she went all the way?

Kim whimpered, torn by indecision...

114.content:
"Good morning, Richards, Carver. Anything recorded over the weekend on Mortimer, Bianca, and Gadget?" Kim asked as she put her things in her locker.

"Hi Kim. You're looking well, by the way. It seems to have remained effective throughout the duration. Both Mortimer and Bianca were imperceptible between 400 and 700 nm wavelengths, a.k.a. not on the visible light spectra. Both perceptible on infrared and ultraviolet rays. Our control, Gadget, remained perceptible on IR, Visible, and UV light spectra," Richards reported. He reran through the archive footage to confirm the report.

Kim allowed herself a smile. She had finished washing her hands and was putting on a fresh lab coat. "Carver, any response noted on the mice themselves?"

Carver shook his head. "M, B, and G all maintained normal vitals and activity levels. Importantly, G would sometimes bump into M or B, but M and B did not bump into G. M and B, in addition to normal behavior, did not bump into each other, indicative of the Gyges device allows for other users to perceive them."

Kim brought a hand to her mouth to stifle an expletive. "Really!"

Carver nodded and was starting to be infected with a grin too. "I'll verify the video with the time signals, but almost certainly yes. We might have lucked into the proper calibration!"

Kim couldn't restrain a small hop from giddiness. She blushed, though her colleagues could relate. "Of course we'll need to replicate in full scale trials, but we're so close to getting Tech and Innovation Awards showered on us!"

Kim dashed to her console and scanned the data. "Yes. Gyges functioned in full capacity for the... huh?"

Kim stared at a variable for awhile as Carver and Richards turned to her. "What is it Kim?" Carver asked while Richards moved to see for himself.

"The penetration range reads as low. Very low. Maybe it was altered while miniaturizing the device for trials on living organisms?" Kim rubbed her chin and looked at her teammates. "But video archive confirms their bodies were fully invisible, right?"

Carver nodded firmly and Richards led her to his monitor. "Yeah, no mouse skeleton or organs or even a shadow," Richards affirmed while playing the footage back.

Carver moved over to the mice's sizable cage. "Still invisible now. Really, it might be a plus. If Gyges works with low penetration, it might mean longer term exposure has less side effects."

Kim nodded. "I'll note it, but let's get ready for the full scale human trials."

Richards grimaced. "About that--the primary volunteer called in sick and the alternative hasn't responded."

Kim sighed. "Patience and boldness, gentlemen. Technological progress requires both and we've already contributed the first part. I'm going to be the first human subject for Gyges."

Carver raised his eyebrows and Richards kept his frown. After a moment of thought, Richards cleared his throat. "Kim, I understand your passion. But isn't it unwise for the project lead to be a test subject? How can you objectively report on yourself?"

Kim shook her head. "There's a lot of cases of scientists experimenting on themselves: Salk, Hoffman, Newton. Besides, you two will observe me."

Richards looked to Carver who shrugged and looked at Kim. "I've yet to persuade you out of any course of action once your committed. Still, Richards is right. We'll need to temporarily replace you as an official observer."

Kim nodded in concession and thought a bit. "Okay, here's a solution."

Being a police officer wasn't the most glamorous job in the world, but Kim couldn't deny that she enjoyed it. She got to help her community be a safer place, she wasn't cooped up in a cubicle all day, and she got to enjoy a few perks afforded to police here and there. That didn't change the fact that being on patrol could be incredibly dull at times.

Kim didn't exactly want to have to deal with high pressure situations every day, but sometimes having at least something to do was a welcome change of pace. Otherwise she was simply driving her route for hours on end, keeping an eye out for whatever infractions caught her attention. Kim liked to consider herself one of the more lenient officers on the force, but she still had a quota to fill every month, after all.

Little did Kim know as her radio crackled to life that this next call was going to be far more intense than any she'd taken before. 1453.content:
Kim had been training for this job for months now, doing research, practicing her speech, and immersing herself in the necessary culture. One of the most complicated jobs for many police officers was going undercover, taking on the persona of a criminal in order to infiltrate groups that were otherwise almost impossible to touch. One group in particular had been a nuisance to the department lately, and Kim was the best current candidate for the job of spying on them.

The job was high-risk, and the department wasn't going to take any chances that Kim could be traced back to them should her cover be blown. Simply put, mistakes were not an option, and Kim had a reputation for getting things done right.

This didn't mean the woman wasn't nervous, of course. Quite the opposite in fact, as she found herself settling the butterflies in her stomach even now. When she enrolled in the academy, Kim would have never imagined she'd be going undercover to infiltrate-

154.content:
Kim set down her breakfast on the kitchen counter as she pulled up a stool and sat down, opening up the laptop waiting for her. The laptop was a nondescript affair, plain black and unassuming, but it was an integral part of Kim's job. Unlike the computer Kim had for her own personal use, this laptop was for work purposes only. Bought with cash in another state and accessing the internet through a server that would give her location as somewhere in Eastern Europe, Kim's activities were effectively untraceable. Such drastic measures were necessary when one was a professional hitman.

Kim idly began eating her breakfast as her free hand nimbly navigated to her email, pulling up her newest message and the contract details hidden within. Kim knew the code and its cipher by heart, so she had no trouble reading between the lines of what would normally be considered spam. What the woman read was... unusual, to say the least.

When it became apparent that she wasn't being hired to kill anybody, Kim was ready to close the message then and there. Her job was clearly defined, after all. Then she saw the extra two zeros pinned onto her normal rate. That was more than enough to keep her attention.

The target was a woman by the name of Veronica Sinclaire, some kind of mega-rich woman with political connections. Whoever was hiring Kim didn't want Veronica dead, but rather wanted her reputation and dignity in tatters. In addition to the huge increase in pay, the employer was offering a substantial bonus if Kim could fulfill her objectives in "creative" ways.

Thankfully, Kim prided herself on being inventive. Sure, she wasn't exactly inventive when it came to what her client wanted, but she could certainly improvise. Now, she just had to get close to her target, and Kim already knew just where to strike...
154.title: Professional hitman

choices: Try to sneak aboard as is.
1542.content:
Kim sighed in annoyance as she scoped out the party through a pair of high-powered binoculars. Had this been a normal assignment she could've brought her rifle up to the warehouse roof she was on and simply picked off the target at her leisure.

As it was, she needed to find some way onto the large yacht at the end of the marina without being detected by security. Easier said than done for a private party hosted by a wealthy and influential woman for other wealthy and influential people in the middle of a bright sunny afternoon. She knew the routes in, but getting aboard would be a hassle. Luckily for Kim, there were certainly options in place.

The party hadn't fully started yet and there were still more guests arriving. While it was an "invitation only" affair, it shouldn't be too difficult to find a wayward guest and...persuade them to give up theirs. She would need a fancier outfit to complete the look though.

Another way in could be swimming aboard and stealing the uniform of one of Sinclaire's employees, so she could pose as a caterer or even one of her bodyguards. Of course, there was the usual risk of one of the employees realizing they had no idea who the "new girl" was.

Otherwise, she could certainly pretend to be a photographer if she needed an excuse to be in the area. Her more casual outfit consisting of a jacket, t-shirt and jeans did give her that "poor paparazzi" look, and she did have a camera in her car trunk. It wouldn't get her in by any means, but it wouldn't raise too many questions if a paparazzo was found trying to sneak aboard and did open up the opportunity to bribe someone to get in.

Worse comes to worse, at least she still had the tranq-gun with a silencer in her back pocket. Bit less lethal than she was used to, but should help if needed. Now, how shall Kim get aboard?
1542.title: Veronica's private yacht as she hosted a pa...

15421.content:
Kim skirted the edges of the marina, keeping an eye on the incoming guests while staying out of sight. If she was going to get her hands on an invitation, she'd need to lure her victim away undetected. Doing that meant finding a guest that seemed gullible enough to help a stranger in need.

It didn't take long for Kim to find a suitable candidate, thankfully. A shapely young woman in a black dress clearly tailored to her form. Her auburn hair and pretty green eyes gave off a pleasant, helpful aura. She was clearly the kind of person that everybody could get along with, and exactly the kind of person Kim needed for her plan to work.

"Pssst. Miss.. Hey, miss!" Kim loudly whispered from the bathroom she'd used as her observation post.

Kim's target stopped in her tracks, turning her head in Kim's direction with a confused look on her face. "Me?" she asked, pointing to herself.

"Yes, you! Miss, please, I need some help!" Kim pleaded. "I, uh... I need a hand with something."

The woman stepped forward, perhaps a bit hesitantly, while Kim kept most of her body hidden behind the bathroom wall. The young woman was still out of arms reach when she stopped short, earning a silent curse from Kim.

"What's wrong?" the woman asked. "Is there no toilet paper or something?"

"No... not exactly." Kim said, putting on her best embarrassed face. She'd need to come up with a strong lie, and one that would elicit this woman's sympathy. Thankfully, the assassin had something planned. "My boyfriend, well, soon-to-be-ex-boyfriend, lured me in here so we could... well, you know." Kim started, noting the light blush that quickly came to the woman's features. "But, once I was ready to go, he took all my stuff and ran off! Bastard didn't even leave me a phone to call for help! Could I borrow yours? I just need to call a friend to bring me something to wear."

"Oh, you poor thing!" the woman cried, reaching into her handbag as she stepped closer to the bathroom entrance. "What kind of monster would leave a poor woman naked and defenseless in a place like this?! Why, it's- ah!"

The woman was cut off as Kim quickly reached out and grabbed her and pulled her into the bathroom. Spinning the woman around, Kim quickly pressed a chloroform-soaked rag over the woman's mouth and nose. It wasn't long at all before the woman's struggling ceased and she went still, completely unconscious. Kim might have been a contract killer, but she didn't kill people other than her targets without good reason.

Dragging the woman into a stall, Kim quickly sat her victim down on the toilet before searching her bag for the invitation she needed. Thankfully it was an easy find. Now there was just the matter of appropriate attire.

"Nothing personal, hun. You understand." Kim whispered to the unconscious woman as she began gently pulling the dress off her body.

A few minutes later, Kim stepped out of the bathroom the picture of sophistication. The woman's black dress flattered her own form quite well, and the high heeled shoes she had worn were even the same size. Proud of her discerning eye, Kim nonchalantly dumped her original outfit in a garbage can a few dozen meters away from the bathroom, quickly making her way down the marina to the ship. The assassin felt a small pang of guilt in leaving the poor girl in the same situation she herself had made up, but she quickly wrote it off as part of the job.

Speaking of the job, it was time to get closer to her target. Kim walked up to the ship with all the confidence in the world, sure that getting past security would be no problem now.

There was just one little hiccup in this plan...

Kim smiled at the security guard as he handed back the invite, though inwardly she was panicking. Who the hell was Ms. Prima?!

She began walking up the gangplank, her face betraying none of the panicked thoughts running through her mind. Obviously an event like this would have some kind of entertainment, but what was she expected to do? Clearly this "Prima" woman wasn't immediately recognizable, else the guard would've detained her, yet she had no idea what kind of performance she was supposed to put on.

A brief grimace crossed Kim's face as she thought of the possibilities; she might be able to fake her way through as a dancer or musician, but she was a terrible singer and would give herself away immediately. She paled as the possibility that Prima was a stripper entered her mind. Hopefully the party was a little too fancy for that kind of thing.

Although, this did have potential. A famous performer could probably get quite close to Ms. Sinclaire without arousing too much suspicion.

The disguised hitman brought up a smile as she walked onto the deck of the ship, only to immediately be approached by a young blonde woman in a royal blue bikini, a little name-tag on the right breast of the suit identifying her as an employee.

"Excuse me," she spoke up, looking at the clipboard in her hands, "Are you Ms. Adeline Prima?"

"Well, that's the name on my invitation," Kim responded, grinning at the little inside-joke and getting a giggle from the girl.

"Oh."

Oh.

On one hand, she did want to get close to Sinclaire, and that's exactly what was happening. A chance to talk to the woman, try and find something out straight from her target; that could be valuable. On the other hand.... Sinclaire was likely to be well guarded, maybe not expecting her performer to be a snake, but chances are her security would be tightest around the woman herself. If she didn't recognize Kim as an imposter- which she might, since Ms. Prima was apparently important enough to warrant a face-to-face introduction with the cruise's host- then the chance of a bodyguard or security head recognizer her was way higher than Kim might be comfortable with.

The employee in front of her didn't seem to notice Kim's trepidation though, especially since Kim was trained enough to keep that sort of thing from showing at a glance. With her back turned, only glancing over every so often, it'd be easy to subdue her, or slink away... but both of those would be suspicious enough in their own right. She might be walking straight into the lion's den if she kept on the way she was going, but the risk could pay off... but in her line of work, Kim wasn't so keen on taking risks.

It didn't take long for her to come to a decision. She couldn't risk exposure this soon, so the girl needed to be out of the picture. Kim casually scanned the hall as they walked through the yacht, keeping her eyes open for an unoccupied room. The assassin kept a smile plastered on her face, waiting for the right moment.

Said moment came soon enough as they approached a door marked "Guest Room 7". The hall was clear, the door had been left open, and she could easily see no one was inside. In the split second she was right next to the doorway, Kim lunged forward, wrapping one arm around the surprised employee's throat and clamping her other hand over the girl's nose and mouth. She quickly pulled the bikini-clad blonde into the room, turning around and shoving the door closed with her back.

Her mind quickly noted the sparse arrangements--a single bed and closet, ceiling lamp, nothing that could be used as a weapon--before turning her attention back to the girl in her arms, who was curiously limp. Did she really go unconscious already? She could feel shallow breath on her palm, so she hadn't inadvertently killed the blonde.

Carefully, Kim began to lower the unconscious(?) girl to the floor, only to gasp in shock and pain as an elbow was shoved into her stomach. She immediately tried to clamp down on the pain and keep ahold of the woman, but she twisted out of Kim's grip.

The blonde grinned and reached behind herself, pulling a collapsable baton on the increasingly bewildered assassin.

1542132132.content:
Oh. Well this was unexpected. "Seriously? You're a hitman?"

"Personally prefer assassin, but yeah, I'm a hitman," the woman responded, still smirking playfully, "Feel free to call me Sierra. And you still haven't guessed yet."

"I'd think it's obvious. I'm your target." While she was quite aware of the various dangers prominent in the profession of hitman for hire, Kim honestly hadn't expected to be attacked on a job by another assassin. This job just kept getting weirder. Not as bad as the Chinatown job, but still.

"You got it. Heh, y'know, most people tend to freak out at this point, but you're pretty calm. Then again, you did attack me first. You usually assault the staff, or was I just that obvious?"

"No, you were doing a good job," Kim replied, trying to find a way out of the situation. The only thing in the room that could be used as a weapon, the baton, was currently held by the very person trying to kill her. Kim wasn't about to try attacking a hired killer without a plan, no matter laid-back the girl seemed to be. "I just really didn't want to see Sinclaire without a plan."

"Heh, I can understand that. Guess even performers get stage fright." Hold on, what? "Not to worry though. I hear letting the audience see you naked builds confidence. Or was that imagining the audience naked? I dunno, I can never keep track."

"Excuse me?"
